channel.title: Linguistics game
channel.description:
Hello, I came upon the [Yukaghir love letter explained](http://historyview.blogspot.com/2011/10/yukaghir-girl-writes-love-letter.html) and immediately thought of making a game out of it. But I am lazy and would like your help to gather parts from other games.
I thought of Dialect, because... linguistics, but there's also this sign language teaching game, and these ideogram teaching games - Yes @Ben_Bisogno I'm looking at you ;) - and I think Sign In Stranger, with its way of getting to know an alien culture by way of an abstract map of things and concepts. And many others I ignore, maybe about mystery, communication ?
If you know such a game, how do you see it working for a "text drawing" (// map drawing) game. Where do you think it would fail ?
Thanks in advance for your help.

item.title: Linguistics game
item.dc:creator: @DeReel
item.description:
@DeReel wrote:

The magic word was “kanji” : it lead me straight to Spells with Character (Bisogno) :

Formatting Cards for "Spells with Character" a RPG system for learning how to spell in Japanese Game Design
My question: What could be improved? Is the way to use this card self evident? The project: I am at the start of a long project developing an RPG system for learning how to write in Japanese. I am trying to develop a minimal viable example for a playtest. The system: Inspired by No Dice No Masters, players would invoke a “spell component”, a part of the character, and do something in-game associated with it. Then the player would flip the card, write the character without seeing it, and c…

… and thanks to @Majcher it bounces me to Magicians : language learning RPG (Symons)

drivethrurpg.com

Magicians: Language Learning RPG - Samjoko Publishing | DriveThruRPG.com

Magicians is a tabletop role-playing game designed to both tell awesome stories like you've read about in books like Har


@Kyle_Simons ?

Although I’m going the other way around, from a drawing to a language that doesn’t exist, I hope you can help me.
